Hi Kevin,

Once you get it to work for simple problems but it still doesn't=
 work for
more complicated ones you might also want to take a look at ES-Hy=
perNEAT:
http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/ESHyperNEAT/

We showed that ES-HyperNEAT =
performs better than HyperNEAT in more complex
tasks that require elaborati=
ng on previously discovered stepping stones,
which a classificaiton task mi=
ght requiere (
http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/papers/risi_alife12.pdf).

Sebastian=



On Mon, Jun 9, 2014 at 7:54 AM, kstanley@... [neat] <
neat@yah=
oogroups.com> wrote:

>
>
> Kevin, good luck with tracking down the problem=
s.  I do think simplifying
> down to something almost trivial can help to e=
xpose problems.  If you still
> experience difficulty please feel free to e=
mail me.
>
> Best,
>
> ken
>  
>



-- 
Dr. Sebastian Risi
